qas.question: What year did the Everton Football Club "go blue"?
How did Steve Bloomer describe Everton's style of play in 1928?
What is Everton Football Club's semi-official club nickname?
What was Everton's nickname when they wore black before 1901?
What was Everton Football Club called after winning the 1995 FA Cup?
Who did Steve Bloomer play for during his career?
In what year did David Moyes arrive as manager of Everton?
Who came up with the nickname "The Blues"?
What team did Steve Bloomer manage later in his career?

context: <b5_0><b8_0>Everton<b8_0/><b5_0/> have had many other nicknames over the years. When the black kit was worn Everton were nicknamed "<a3_0>The Black Watch<a3_0/>", after the famous army regiment. Since going blue in <a0_0>1901<a0_0/>, Everton have been given the simple nickname "The Blues". Everton's attractive style of play led to Steve Bloomer calling the team "<a1_0>scientific<a1_0/>" in 1928, which is thought to have inspired the nickname "The School of Science". The battling <b6_0>1995<b6_0/> FA Cup winning side were known as "<a4_0>The Dogs of War<a4_0/>". When <b7_0>David Moyes<b7_0/> arrived as manager he proclaimed Everton as "<a2_0>The People's Club<a2_0/>", which has been adopted as a semi-official club nickname.
